transcript.text: Are you surprised at what constitutes an export? Does it seem hard to believe that export issues could apply to regular business activities? This is a reality for global companies like ours. Click on each heading to confirm your understanding of the law.

contentText.text: Export issues can arise at any time as part of regular business activities. Check your understanding of the rules.

instructionText.text: Click on Next (bottom right arrow) to continue.

popText.text:
Exports happen when goods are carried or shipped across borders – but they can also occur without you ever leaving the
country, including during a conversation, on the web, in an email, at trade shows or during a facility tour.

revealCallOut.img: Employee working with Johnson Controls technology

popText.text: Trade regulations require that Johnson Controls has authorization to export products, technology or services. Certain sanctions also prohibit us from doing business with certain individuals, entities and countries, and we can’t support or participate in unsanctioned boycotts.

revealCallOut.img: Trade Control Expert on the phone

popText.text: We have trade compliance experts in place who can help you. Contact a member of the Trade team with any export / import related questions or concerns you may have.
